intro: Meibomia dimorpha, commonly known as the two-form meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Meibomia dimorpha is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
